page.title: 02Landscape NORTHBOROUGH
page.content: Northborough is a village (pop.1200) about 7 miles north of Peterborough. The A15 runs past the edge of the village. The village shop, which sells everything, contains a post office. There is a church and a primary school. Some houses in Northborough are very old, but in some areas building is still going on. The older houses are usually built of stone and thatch while modern houses are built of brick and tile. There is a community centre, out_side of which there is a grass area with swings, a climbing frame, a BMX track and a football pitch. It is used as the village play_ground. The village has a pub, opposite which is a fortified manor-house. This was once occupied by Oliver Cromwell's sister and has been used as a restaurant.
